availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Leitchfield, Kentucky, farmer. Maryland native. Married to Sarah Hackett. Father of Henry Hackett, Josephine Hackett, James B. Hackett, William F. Hackett, Minerva E. Hackett, John R. Hackett, George W. Hackett, Sarah E. Hackett, Charles G. Hackett, and Ben A. Hackett. Peddler in Lawrence County, Indiana, in 1850. Farmer in Leitchfield in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Lawrence County, Marion, p. 348. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 166. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Litchfield, p. 12. Find A Grave, "William Hackett (1812-1896)," Memorial #70195028, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=70195028 (accessed June 23, 2017).
